reason: The statement claims L_{tau<-1} 'acts nontrivially on H_1^{(2)}' and L_{1<-tau} 'acts nontrivially only on H_tau^{(1)}', but the paper explicitly warns (TeX line 282) that the kernel/projector analysis alone 'do[es] not guarantee that the action indeed is non-trivial.' The nontriviality is only established via the composition results in nodes 1.3.1-1.3.2. Either (a) the statement should be weakened to say 'can only act nontrivially on' (matching the paper's phrasing) or (b) an explicit dependency on 1.3.1/1.3.2 should be added.
